page.title: 17Town and Country
page.content: The{houses}on Woodhall Farm are very {close together and have very small {gardens}whereas around it the {country-side is very open and gently {undulating with scattered woodland.}It is at much the same height apart from the south-west corner where the River Gade flows in a{deep valley}towards Hemel Hempstead. Many of the fields have a depression in the middle. This is sometimes quite shallow and ploughed over but is often so deep it is left as a {tree-filled dell.} The dell to the East of Eastbrook Hay Farm is the deepest and has chalk cliffs showing the layer of{chalk rock}that underlies the{clay soil.}The farmer here still occasionally mines out the chalk to spread on the fields as they did about 100 years ago but usually the dell is only used to dump and burn rubbish.
